title: Rory Stewart is a classic Privileged Crusader: compassionate, restless and wants to run the world
text:
People are trying to work out why Rory Stewart shouldn’t run for Mayor of London. Is he too white? Too posh? Too odd? No: the problem isn’t that he’s running in London but that he isn’t running in Penrith, his current constituency. Mr Stewart fell out with the Tories over Brexit, which can’t be helped, but why not run as an independent at the next general election? He’d join a great tradition of MPs – Tony Benn, Michael Portillo – who stood and lost and re-entered the Commons at a later date to fight their cause.

Instead, he joins another tradition of MPs – David Miliband, Tristram Hunt – who realised they’d hit a ceiling in Parliament and so flounced off to do something else. I call them the...
description: People are trying to work out why Rory Stewart shouldn’t run for Mayor of London.
